sen.j: 粟谷 菊生（あわや きくお、1922年（大正11年）10月31日 - 2006年（平成18年）10月11日）はシテ方喜多流の能楽師。
sen.e: Kikuo AWAYA (October 31, 1922 to October 11, 2006) was a shite-kata (main roles of Noh actor) Nohgakushi of Kita school.
Kikuo AWAYA (October 31, 1922 - October 11, 2006) was a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing shite (the principal roles) of Kita-ryu school.
Kikuo AWAYA (October 31, 1922 - October 11, 2006) was a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing shite (the principal roles) of Kita-ryu school.

sen.j: 重要無形文化財各個指定保持者（人間国宝）。
sen.e: He was an individual holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).
He was an individual holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).
He was an individual holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).

sen.j: 日本芸術院会員。
sen.e: He was a member of the Japan Art Academy.
He was a member of the Japan Art Academy.
He was a member of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 社団法人日本能楽会会長。
sen.e: He was the chairman of the Association for Japanese Noh Plays.
He was the chairman of the Association for Japanese Noh Plays.
He was the chairman of the Association for Japanese Noh Plays.

sen.j: 1922年、粟谷益二郎の次男として東京都で生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Masujiro AWAYA in 1922 in Tokyo.
He was born as the second son of Masujiro AWAYA in 1922 in Tokyo Prefecture.
He was born as the second son of Masujiro AWAYA in 1922 in Tokyo Prefecture.

sen.j: 名付け親は喜多実。
sen.e: His name was given by Minoru KITA.
His name was given by Minoru KITA.
His name was given by Minoru KITA.

sen.j: 兄に粟谷新太郎。
sen.e: His older brother is Shintaro AWAYA.
His older brother was Shintaro AWAYA.
His older brother was Shintaro AWAYA.

sen.j: 弟に粟谷辰三・粟谷幸雄。
sen.e: His younger brothers are Tatsuzo AWAYA and Yukio AWAYA.
His younger brothers are Tatsuzo AWAYA and Yukio AWAYA.
His younger brothers are Tatsuzo AWAYA and Yukio AWAYA.

sen.j: 息子に粟谷明生。
sen.e: His son is Akio AWAYA.
His son is Akio AWAYA.
His son is Akio AWAYA.

sen.j: 父および喜多流十五世・喜多実、十四世・喜多六平太能心に師事。
sen.e: He studied under his father, Minoru KITA, who was the 15th Kita-ryu Soke (the head family or house of Kita school), and Roppeita-Noshin KITA, who was the 14th Kita-ryu Soke.
He studied under his father, Minoru KITA, who was the 15th head of Kita-ryu school, and Roppeita Noshin KITA, who was the 14th head.
He studied under his father, Minoru KITA, who was the 15th head of Kita-ryu school, and Roppeita Noshin KITA, who was the 14th head.

sen.j: 喜多実の厳正重厚さと六平太の絢爛自在さをあわせもつといわれ、羽衣・安宅・景清など幅広い演目を得意とした。
sen.e: It is said that he was gifted with both the refined and dignified style of Minoru KITA, and the opulent and universal style of Roppeita, which made him a first-class performer of a wide range of programs, including Hagoromo (The Feather Mantle), Ataka and Kagekiyo.

It is said that he was gifted with both the refined and dignified style of Minoru KITA, and the opulent and universal style of Roppeita, which made him a first-class actor of a wide range of programs, including Hagoromo (The Feather Mantle), Ataka (The Ataka Barrier) and Kagekiyo (General Kagekiyo).

It is said that he was gifted with both the refined and dignified style of Minoru KITA, and the opulent and universal style of Roppeita, which made him a first-class actor of a wide range of programs, including Hagoromo (The Feather Mantle), Ataka (The Ataka Barrier) and Kagekiyo (General Kagekiyo).

sen.j: 謡の表現力にも定評があり、シテを引退した後も地頭として活躍。
sen.e: His Utai (the chanting of a Noh text) also earned an established reputation, and after he had retired from shite, he showed distinguished activity as a jigashira (the leader of the group reciters).

His Utai (the chanting of a Noh text) also earned an established reputation, and after he had retired from shite (main role), he showed distinguished activity as a jigashira (the leader of the group reciters).

His Utai (the chanting of a Noh text) also earned an established reputation, and after he had retired from shite (main role), he showed distinguished activity as a jigashira (the leader of the group reciters).

sen.j: 大阪大学に能楽研究会を設立し死去まで30年以上指導を続けるなど能楽の普及にも力を注いだ。
sen.e: He also contributed in propagating Nogaku (the art of Noh) by founding the Noh study group at Osaka University and instructed Noh for 30 years or more until he died.
He also contributed in propagating Nohgaku (the art of Noh) by founding the Noh study group at Osaka University and instructed Noh for more than 30 years until he died.
sen.cmt: 表記を統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: He also contributed in propagating Nohgaku (the art of Noh) by founding the Noh study group at Osaka University and instructed Noh for more than 30 years until he died.

sen.j: 芸術祭 (文化庁)奨励賞・芸術祭優秀賞・観世寿夫記念法政大学能楽賞・日本芸術院賞受賞。
sen.e: He was awarded Arts Festival (Japanese Agency for Cultural Affairs) Grand Prize, Arts Festival Excellence Award, the Hosei University Noh Drama Prize in Memory of Kanze Hisao, and Award of the Japan Art Academy.

He was awarded Arts Festival (Japanese Agency for Cultural Affairs) Grand Prize, Arts Festival Excellence Award, the Hosei University Noh Drama Prize in Memory of Hisao KANZE, and Award of the Japan Art Academy.

He was awarded Arts Festival (Japanese Agency for Cultural Affairs) Grand Prize, Arts Festival Excellence Award, the Hosei University Noh Drama Prize in Memory of Hisao KANZE, and Award of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 1996年人間国宝、2003年日本芸術院会員。
sen.e: He was designated a Living National Treasure in 1996, and became a member of the Japan Art Academy in 2003.
He was designated a Living National Treasure in 1996, and became a member of the Japan Art Academy in 2003.
He was designated a Living National Treasure in 1996, and became a member of the Japan Art Academy in 2003.

sen.j: 2006年10月11日に心不全のため83歳にて死去。
sen.e: He died of cardiac failure on October 11, 2006 at the age of 83.
He died of cardiac failure on October 11, 2006 at the age of 83.
He died of cardiac failure on October 11, 2006 at the age of 83.

sen.j: 叙・正五位、授・旭日中綬章。
sen.e: He was investitured with the rank of Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) and the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon.
He was investitured with the rank of Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) and the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon.
He was investitured with the rank of Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) and the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon.

sen.j: 戒名は玄能院妙謡菊生居士。
sen.e: His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Gennoin Myoyo Kikuo Koji.
sen.cmt: 玄能院妙謡菊生居士：全体の読みが不明です。
sen.e: His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Gennoin Myoyo Kikuo Koji (玄能院妙謡菊生居士).
sen.cmt: 読み不明の漢字を補足しました。
sen.e: His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Gennoin Myoyo Kikuo Koji (玄能院妙謡菊生居士).

sen.j: 歌手のペギー葉山は従兄妹。
sen.e: Peggy HAYAMA, who is a singer, is a cousin.
Peggy HAYAMA, who is a singer, is his cousin.
Peggy HAYAMA, who is a singer, is his cousin.

sen.j: 俳優の丹波哲郎は中学の同級生。
sen.e: Tetsuro TANBA was his classmate at the junior high school.
Tetsuro TANBA, an actor, was his classmate at the junior high school.
Tetsuro TANBA, an actor, was his classmate at the junior high school.

sen.j: 年表
sen.e: Timeline
Timeline
Timeline

sen.j: 1925年 『鞍馬天狗』 花見で初舞台
sen.e: 1925: He made his debut at the scene of Hanami in "Kurama Tengu."
1925: Made his debut at the scene of Hanami (cherry blossom viewing) in "Kurama Tengu."
sen.cmt: 主語を省略し、用語補足しました。
sen.e: 1925: Made his debut at the scene of Hanami (cherry blossom viewing) in "Kurama Tengu."

sen.j: 1928年 『猩々』初シテ
sen.e: 1928: He performed the role of shite in "Shojo" (The Tipster Sprite) for the first time.
1928: Performed the role of shite in "Shojo" (The Tipster Sprite) for the first time.
1928: Performed the role of shite in "Shojo" (The Tipster Sprite) for the first time.

sen.j: 1947年 『猩々乱』披き
sen.e: 1947: He performed "Shojo Midare" (The Disorderly Tipster Sprite) for the first time.
1947: Performed "Shojo Midare" (The Disorderly Tipster Sprite) for the first time.
1947: Performed "Shojo Midare" (The Disorderly Tipster Sprite) for the first time.

sen.j: 1953年 『道成寺』披き
sen.e: 1953: He performed "Dojo-ji Temple" for the first time.
1953: Performed "Dojoji" (Dojo-ji Temple) for the first time.
sen.cmt: 主語を省略し、用語を変えました。
sen.e: 1953: Performed "Dojoji" (Dojo-ji Temple) for the first time.

sen.j: 1954年 第一回能楽渡欧団参加。
sen.e: 1954: He participated in the first Noh performance tour to Europe.
1954: Participated in the first Noh performance tour to Europe.
1954: Participated in the first Noh performance tour to Europe.

sen.j: 能楽初の海外公演。
sen.e: It was the first Noh performance abroad.
It was the first Noh performance abroad.
It was the first Noh performance abroad.

sen.j: 1991年 『卒塔婆小町』披き。
sen.e: 1991: He performed "Sotoba Komachi" for the first time.
1991: Performed "Sotoba Komachi" for the first time.
1991: Performed "Sotoba Komachi" for the first time.

sen.j: 1992年 観世寿夫記念法政大学能楽賞受賞。
sen.e: 1992: He received the Hosei University Noh Drama Prize in Memory of Kanze Hisao.
1992: Received the Hosei University Noh Drama Prize in Memory of Hisao KANZE.
sen.cmt: 主語を省略し、用語を変えました。
sen.e: 1992: Received the Hosei University Noh Drama Prize in Memory of Hisao KANZE.

sen.j: 1994年 『伯母捨』披き。
sen.e: 1994: He performed "Obasute" (The Old Woman Abandoned in the Hills) for the first time.
1994: Performed "Obasute" (The Old Woman Abandoned in the Hills) for the first time.
1994: Performed "Obasute" (The Old Woman Abandoned in the Hills) for the first time.

sen.j: 流儀180年ぶり。
sen.e: It was the first performance of the school in 180 years.
It was the first performance of the school in 180 years.
It was the first performance of the school in 180 years.

sen.j: 1995年 双光旭日章受章
sen.e: 1995: He received Sokokyokujitsusho (The Order of the Rising Sun, Gold and Silver Rays).
1995: Received Soko kyokujitsusho (The Order of the Rising Sun, Gold and Silver Rays).
1995: Received Soko kyokujitsusho (The Order of the Rising Sun, Gold and Silver Rays).

sen.j: 1996年 重要無形文化財各個指定(人間国宝)
sen.e: 1996: He was designated an individual holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).
1996: Designated an individual holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).
1996: Designated an individual holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).

sen.j: 2000年 日本芸術院賞
sen.e: 2000: He received Award of the Japan Art Academy.
2000: Received Award of the Japan Art Academy.
2000: Received Award of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 2003年 日本芸術院会員
sen.e: 2003: He became a member of the Japan Art Academy.
2003: Became a member of the Japan Art Academy.
2003: Became a member of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 2004年 『景清』舞い納め
sen.e: 2004: He performed "Kagekiyo" for the last time.
2004: Performed "Kagekiyo" for the last time.
